repnme.cdata!:
India - Andhra Pradesh Economic Reform
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and institutional
            development impacts substantial. Lessons convey the
            following. Research and experience suggest that reform
            programs are more likely to succeed when owned, and designed
            by the countries themselves, furthermore if supported by a
            series of single-tranche adjustment operations, which are
            better suited for supporting a multiple-year reform process.
            Although this entails higher administrative costs for the
            Bank, the process supports the required incentive mechanism,
            and, facilitates an exit strategy for the Bank, if the
            reform program falters. For example in this case, a
            follow-up adjustment operation will be based on the
            continuation of the reform program. However the pace of
            progress of different components of a government-owned
            reform program varies, thus it is important to determine the
            critical elements of the program, where progress is needed,
            and how would the pace sustain the credibility of the
            overall program; i.e., in Andhra Pradesh, unless the
            financial performance of the power sector is improved on a
            sustained basis, the fiscal reform will remain tentative. A
            possibility could have been to agree on specific actions
            that would have helped improve the power sector financial
            performance. Finally, it is highlighted that partnerships,
            particularly with other external agencies, bring useful
            technical, and financial resources, regardless of its higher costs.

repnme.cdata!:
India - Andhra Pradesh Economic Reform
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Andhra Pradesh Economic Reform
            Loan/Credit Project (APERL) supports the State of Andhra
            Pradesh's fiscal and governance reform program. The
            fiscal reform program aims for fiscal stabilization to
            reduce the debt burden and restore sustainability to public
            finances, improve public resource mobilization, and
            restructure public spending toward priority development
            areas. This is accompanied by public expenditure management
            reform to strengthen financial management capacity and
            institutions, improve the realism and credibility of the
            budget, enhance fiscal transparency and accountability, and
            introduce greater efficiency to operational management. The
            program of governance reform includes strengthening
            anti-corruption efforts, civil service reform, electronic
            governance, public enterprise reform, and a program of
            poverty monitoring and analysis. There are fourteen specific
            triggers or prerequisite actions that had to be completed
            for the APERL, which, as detailed in this report, have been
            completed. The expected beenfits proceeding from this
            project are: 1) strengthening the government's fiscal
            and financial health; 2) a more conducive investment climate
            for private sector growth; 30 more efficient and effective
            public service delivery; and 4) improved social outcomes and
            reduced poverty. The loan/credit will be disbursed in one tranche.
